paragraphs.content: If-Else statements allow for specific blocks of code to be executed only if a specified condition is either true or false.

openChoiceQuiz.question: Finish the missing keyword: If-Else statements are used to only run specific _____ of code if a condition is true or false.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Blocks of code are multiple lines of code.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Sorry, but that's the wrong answer! The correct answer is 'blocks'. Blocks of code are multiple lines of code.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an if statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement on its own; without an else or else if (covered later in the topic). The if statement is used to specify a block of code which is to be executed only if the condition (in the brackets) is true.

images.caption: 'Example on how to create an if statement'

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: The condition for an if statement is specified outside of brackets.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct, fantastic work! The condition is in fact specified inside of the brackets directly after the if keyword.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The condition is in fact specified inside of the brackets directly after the if keyword.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an else statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement with an else statement. The else statement is used to execute a block of code (specified within the else curly brackets) only if all of the other conditions are false.

images.caption: 'Example on how to create an if statement with an else clause'

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: The else statement does not require a condition to be specified.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct, you're doing great! Else statements do not require conditions as they are a last resort case so they are only activated when other conditions fail.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! Else statements do not require conditions as they are a last resort case so they are only activated when other conditions fail.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an else-if statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement with an else-if statement and an else statement all together!

images.caption: 'Example on how to create an if statement with an else if and an else clause'

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: The else-if statement can only be declared after an if statement and before an else statement.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Else-if statements are optional and if they are declared, they must be after an if statement and before an else (if there is an else clause).
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! Else-if statements are optional and if they are declared, they must be after an if statement and before an else (if there is an else clause).

paragraphs.content: The else-if statement is just like a regular if statement with the exception that it specifies a seperate condition in its own brackets.
You can as many else-if statements as you desire whereas, you can only have one if and one else statement.

paragraphs.subheading: Tips to remember with If-Else statements
paragraphs.content: Remember that the if statement must be the first condition in an If-Else statement block, with the else-if's going after it and the else being the final condition if all the other conditions return false.
Also, else statements and else-if statements within an If-Else block are NOT REQUIRED. You can have an if statement on its own however, you cannot have just an else-if or an else on its own.
